New York University Archives
Charles F. Gosnell Papers
Gosnell, Charles Francis, 1909-1993
MC.58
0.25 Linear Feet
1967-1969 Charles F. Gosnell served as Director of Libraries at New York University (NYU) and taught library administration and law in the University's School of Law. This collection includes articles, programs, and a member list of the Free and Accepted Masons along with a booklet by the St. David's Society of the State of New York.
Arrangement
This collection is arranged in two series: Grand Master of Masons and St. David's Society of the State of New York. Within each series, folders are arranged chronologically.
Biography
Charles F. Gosnell served as Director of Libraries at New York University (NYU) and professor at NYU's School of Law, specializing in civil liberties and constitutional law, from 1962 to 1974. During this time he served as a consultant to the University of Brasilia and to the Inter-American Development Bank and headed a UNESCO survey of public library services in Colombia.
Prior to these appointments, he was head of the New York State Library in Albany from 1945 to 1962. As State Librarian and Assistant Commissioner of Health and Education in New York, Dr. Gosnell received national attention in the early 1950s for his studies showing the deplorable state and neglect of the country's public libraries.
Upon his retirement from NYU in 1974, Gosnell was named adviser to the United States General Services Administration on archives and records centers.
Gosnell also served as the Grand Master of Masons in the State of New York.
Gosnell died in 1993 at his home in Utica, New York.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Charles F. Gosnell Papers; MC 58; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.
Scope and Contents
This collection contains articles, programs, and lists pertaining to Gosnell's membership in and leadership positions within the Masons.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the creator are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from New York University Archives, (212) 998-2646, university-archives@nyu.edu.
Processing Information
Processing information before 2019 is unavailable.
Custodial History
Transferred from Gould Memorial Library at an unspecified date.
